CatDescriptText: Mr. Joseph Jones, cab driver, 2103 Webster Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 28, 1957, pg. 3, with question: "What do you think of race relations here in Pittsburgh?" Answer reads: "I don't think very highly of race relations here in Pittsburgh. In many cases a Negro has a hard time when he enters a place of public accommodation.  Just recently three or four colored teenagers who seemed to be reliable, told me that they were chased out of a downtown restaurant where they attempted to eat."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Joseph Jones standing behind open car door with Gimbles Department Store in background, Smithfield Street, Downtown
